poem:
### Corporate Shadows

Names echo—Darth, Santa—  
on the register's page,  
a dance of whispers  
in ledger's light.  
  
New powers, mute  
as paper. Fines  
drift away—  
£1,250 adrift.  
  
Fraud's ghost laughs  
invisible,  
while reforms shuffle  
quietly in the corridors.  
Who will catch the shadows  
naming the wind?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Companies House collects just £1,250 in fines in corruption crackdown The UK government agency responsible for overseeing a national register of companies has collected just £1,250 in fines after being given new powers to crack down on corruption, it has emerged. Companies House is implementing a series of reforms, amid embarrassing revelations about fraudsters and jokers signing up to the corporate register with names such as “Darth Vader” and “Santa Claus”. Measures include new identity". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
